mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Encloses a draft from $500 from the United States bank in Philadelphia; believes that his tobacco crop this year will yield enough to pay William Short the money he owes him; expects the total from the crop to be $3,000; sends the crop to Richmond to be sold; wants these financial debts paid before Short leaves for Europe in the summer; thanks Short for allowing him to pay the debt with his crop rather than through selling a piece of property.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1807 April 06, Washington, [D.C.] to [William] Short, n.p.
